Description: Mould-made pottery lamp decorated on the discus with a lion. The shoulder is decorated with small rosettes and branches in relief. There are ornamental side-lugs and an applied ribbed handle behind an applied bust of Sarapis (head lost). Within the pseudo-base-ring are impressed triple barley ears. Traces of a red-brown slip remain.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2081.bis)
